agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit utility providing water to rural locations.
service_description: Provides water to select areas of Morgan County.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance; (persons with limited mobility should call ahead for instructions). Bills may be paid in person, online, or by mail; a drop box is at this location.
site_eligibility: Addresses within service area

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintainsÂ  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Morgan County

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides shelter and animal control services for unwanted and stray animals.
service_description: Offers certificates for discounted spay or neuter surgeries at participating local veterinarians in Morgan County.
site_details: Contact participating vet to schedule appointment. -- Voucher and payment go directly to the vet.
site_eligibility: Owner of a dog or cat -- Living in Morgan County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides shelter and animal control services for unwanted and stray animals.
service_description: Operates a shelter for stray and unwanted animals and serves as animal control for Morgan County, outside of Mooresville and Martinsville city limits. Accepts reports of animal neglect or abuse; provides lost-and-found services; adopts out animals; and offers low-cost pet microchipping and euthanasia services.
site_details: Stray Animals: Bring the animal to the shelter if possible; if necessary, call to have an officer dispatched. -- For after-hours emergencies, call county dispatch. -- Owner Surrenders: Call to schedule an appointment. -- Lost Pet: Walk in to see if your lost pet has been turned in. (Holding period is 3 days, visit as soon as possible, and re-check often.) -- To Report Abuse/Violations: Call during office hours. If an animal is in imminent danger or is posing immediate danger to others, contact the police. -- For micro-chipping, walk in with animal. -- For euthanasia services, call to schedule an appointment. Situations will be assessed on an individual basis.
site_eligibility: To Surrender a Pet or Stray: Living in Morgan County -- For Animal Control Dispatch: Living in Morgan County, except Mooresville city limits

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides shelter and animal control services for unwanted and stray animals.

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Martinsville in Morgan County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For non-emergency services, call the office during business hours or call Martinsville City dispatch after hours.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- City Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Martinsville

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Morgan County.

site_eligibility: Living in Morgan county

agency_desc: A nonprofit collaboration of churches providing charitable outreach, including a food pantry, emergency financial assistance, clothing, and household items.
service_description: Offers assistance with utilities, rent, or mortgage bills to those in need in Morgan County. Applications are accepted when funds are available; client must first apply for assistance with township trustee. No assistance provided for late fees, deposits, reconnection fees, or telephone bills. Limited service area.
site_details: For rent and other financial assistance: Apply for assistance with township trustee, then call for an appointment. -- For utility assistance: Apply for assistance with township trustee AND South Central community Action Program, then call for an appointment. -- Attend a one-on-one financial counseling appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Morgan County -- Low income or in financial need -- For rent and other financial assistance: Already applied for assistance with township trustee; (denied or additional help needed) -- For utility assistance: Already applied with township trustee AND South Central community Action Program; (denied or additional help needed) -- Limit one assistance per household per year.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization providing temporary shelter and support services to families experiencing homelessness in and around Morgan County.
service_description: Offers temporary shelter for single parents and couples with children as well as pregnant women experiencing homelessness in and around Morgan County. Support services include employment coaching, housing assistance, and life skills classes. Families staying at the shelter have access to a common entertainment area, computer lab, and food pantry. Same-day shelter is not available; the intake process may take several days and usually has a waitlist. Maximum length of stay is 30 days.
site_details: Call to complete a phone assessment. -- Based on assessment findings, an in-person interview may be scheduled for a later time.
site_eligibility: Families experiencing homelessness, which includes any of the following: Single parents with children -- Married or unmarried couples (including same-sex couples) with children -- Pregnant Women

agency_desc: "The goal of CICOA's Meals & More program is to provide appetizing, nutritionally balanced meals to older adults and those with disabilities either in their homes or at one of more than 30 neighborhood meal sites.  The program is designed to relieve hunger and food insecurity, promote socialization and address proper nutrition education." This program serves Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_name: CICOA NEIGHBORHOOD MEAL SITE - MARTINSVILLE AREA SENIOR CENTER
service_description: Offers a hot, nutritious lunch each weekday for area seniors. One day advance notice required.
site_details: Call to make a reservation at least 24 hours in advance.
site_schedule: Meals: Mon, Wed, and Fri noon -- Reservation Line: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older and your spouse -- Building residents that are of any age

service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- For information, call or visit the website to send a message.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Morgan County (with the exception of Brown Township)

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit agency providing emergency shelter for victims of domestic violence, stalking, and/or sexual assault and their dependent children.
service_description: Provides shelter to victims, with or without children, who are fleeing domestic violence and/or are victims of sexual assault/stalking. Secure accommodations are available for up to 24 months, along with support services and referrals to professional counseling, addiction counseling, advocacy, crisis intervention, and safety planning.
site_details: Clients may call directly, referral is not necessary.
site_schedule: Intake: Daily 24 hours (Intake between 10pm-7am usually requires police escort)
site_eligibility: Victims of domestic violence, sexual assault, or stalking -- With or without children -- Fleeing a domestic violence or sexual assault situation

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit agency providing emergency shelter for victims of domestic violence, stalking, and/or sexual assault and their dependent children.
service_description: Provides individual counseling to Morgan County women who are victims of domestic violence and/or sexual assault.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for assessment or more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Morgan County -- Victim of domestic violence, stalking, and/or sexual assault

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Walk in or call for an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Morgan County -- Veterans and surviving spouses and children of veterans

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and Christmas basket program.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Open -- Limit two visits per month

agency_desc:
Seeks to match lower income residents of Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, and Vigo County with local volunteer attorneys for free legal assistance.

Intake applications taken: Tuesdays 5-7pm and Thursdays 11am-1pm
site_name: DISTRICT 10 PRO BONO PROJECT - MORGAN COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_name: LEGAL ASSISTANCE - MORGAN COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_description: Offers a walk-in legal clinic where people in need can speak with volunteer attorneys and law students about family law and get help with paperwork. Consultation only; no legal representation available. First come, first served.
site_details: Clients can access this service by calling (812)269-6463, and if the attorney isn't available to answer, by leaving a message for a call back or to request a zoom session.
site_eligibility: Have a case pending in Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo County -- Able to meet income guidelines; generally 125% of federal poverty guidelines -- Have a civil case that requires an attorney -- Not currently represented by an attorney

service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency serving the needs of area seniors and provides a food pantry open to all.
service_description: Provides transportation within Mooresville to the senior center, medical appointments, grocery stores, and other essential services for area seniors.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not received assistance from this food pantry in the past month.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency serving the needs of area seniors and provides a food pantry open to all.
service_description: Provides frozen and nonperishable food to seniors in need. Limited service area. Accepts donations.
site_details: Walk in; use the Hibbon Street door by the church parking lot.
site_eligibility: Age 55 or older -- Not used this pantry during the current month

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency serving the needs of area seniors and provides a food pantry open to all.
service_description: Offers gently-used clothing and small household items for a small fee. Donated items are always welcome. Proceeds support the senior center.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency serving the needs of area seniors and provides a food pantry open to all.
service_description: Provides social and recreational activities and a hot meal for area seniors. Transportation to and from the center is available for persons in Mooresville.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 9am-3pm; Tues, Wed, and Fri 9am-1pm
site_eligibility: Not received assistance from this food pantry in the past month.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides walk-in blood pressure screening for Morgan County.
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment. -- Screenings are performed as time permits.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Morgan County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information. To request services or file a complaint, complete the online form or print and mail or fax the completed form to this office.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Morgan County

service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years-old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides head lice screening by appointment only. Shampoo for treatment is available to families meeting financial guidelines (assistance is only available once per year per family and only as funding allows).
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. -- Do not bring anyone with head lice into the clinic without prior approval.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers cholesterol and blood sugar screenings by appointment once per month for a fee. Test results are available in five minutes; appointment required.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. -- Do not eat or drink anything other than water or black coffee after midnight the night before testing.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Morgan County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, walk in to pick up an application or call the prosecutor's office for information. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Morgan County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity.) Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.
site_details: Call to make a report; provide as much detail about the situation as possible. -- For emergencies or after-hours reports, please call local office or county dispatch.
site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

agency_desc: Women's shelter providing housing, stability services and addiction recovery programming.
service_description: Provides support to women as they increase accountability and gain the stability needed to live independently. Programming includes educational opportunities, specific job readiness skills, health & wellness, mental health services, addiction recovery programming, spiritual guidance and other support services
site_details: Call to complete a phone assessment.
site_eligibility: Women without children -- Age 18 or older -- Homeless -- Adhere to house rules and program regulations

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF MORGAN COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF MORGAN COUNTY
service_description: Builds and rehabilitates homes for eligible low-income persons in Morgan County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Visit the website for an application; call or email to request information.
site_eligibility: Lived in Morgan County for at least 1 full year -- Household income between 30%-60% of area median (Call or see website for current amounts.) -- Able to make payments (steady employment history or equivalent income) -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit club for youth.
site_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF MORGAN COUNTY
service_description: Provides a positive, supervised environment for young people after school and over the summer. Programs emphasize character and leadership, education and career development, the arts, life skills, health and fitness, sports, and recreation.
site_details: Call, walk in or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: School Year Clubs: Mon-Fri 3pm-7pm -- Summer Clubs: Mon-Fri 7:30am-6pm
site_eligibility: Boys and girls ages 6-18

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth.
site_name: SOUTH CENTRAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - MORGAN COUNTY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Morgan County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Call or visit the website to apply for the waitlist.
site_eligibility: Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: Offers a faith-based full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides walk-in medical care for fevers, sore throats, coughs, rashes, bumps, bruises, and minor injuries. Persons needing more extensive care will be referred to the nearest Franciscan Health hospital.
site_details: Walk in during operating hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a faith-based full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from any Franciscan Health provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income.
site_details: Patients MUST submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance --  Call customer service to request an application or print the application from the website. -- Call Financial Counseling for billing or payment information.
site_eligibility: * Received or receiving medically necessary health care services   from a Franciscan Health provider (or guarantor of someone who received such services)* Low to moderate income for sliding-scale assistance; those below 200%   of Federal Poverty Level may be eligible for free care
